snippet: With fast boats built of the same high-tech materials used in racecars and fighter jets, organizers of the 2013 America’s Cup are hoping that speed will bring back interest in sailing.
abstract: Essay by Aron Pilhofer describes his experience as guest racer aboard America’s Cup catamaran Luna Rossa Swordfish; says that organizers of 2013 America's Cup hope to renew interest in sailing by focusing on speed; notes that vessels competing for the Cup are capable of speeds of greater than 40 miles per hour.
lead_paragraph: With fast boats built of the same high-tech materials used in racecars and fighter jets, organizers of the 2013 America’s Cup are hoping that speed will bring back interest in sailing.

headline.seo: A Heart-Thumping Ride on a Racing Catamaran
headline.main: Skimming the Surface, Inches From Danger
headline.print_headline: Skimming the Surface, Inches From Danger
